channel.title: My Unban Command Unbans Everyone Instead Of The Specific Player...HELP!

item.title: My Unban Command Unbans Everyone Instead Of The Specific Player...HELP!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

It’s simple.
To create the temporary file, you make an instance of the file class with the name of the file you want to create, like so:

File tempBans = new File("bans.txt.tmp");

Make another one for your original ban list:

File bans = new File("bans.txt");

Now, you’re going to need to read from and write to each file, so instantiate a couple of BufferedReaders and BufferedWriters:

BufferedWriter bw;
BufferedReader br;
BufferedWriter tmpwr;
BufferedReader tmpr;

Now, create the temporary file:

tempBans.createNewFile();

The next step would be to make the first BufferedReader read from the main file and the first BufferedWriter write to the temporary file:

br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(bans));
tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tempBans, true));

Now, we read from the main file, writing each name to the temporary file except for the one we don’t want banned:

String readData;
while((readData = br.readLine()) != null)
{
	if(!readData.equalsIgnoreCase(command.substring(6)))
	{
		tmpwr.write(readData);
		tmpwr.newLine();
	}
}
tmpwr.flush();
tmpwr.close();
br.close();
bans.delete();

Now, copy it back to the main ban file:

bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(bans, true));
tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tempBans));

while((readData = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
{
	bw.write(readData);
	bw.newLine();
}

bw.flush();
bw.close();
tmpr.close();
tempBans.delete();

And you’re done.

mr bob silab2:

Your retarted.

If you think there’s something wrong with my idea, please at least offer advice for improvement.
I may not be a good programmer, but you’re even worse, and at least I try.

Read full topic

item.title: My Unban Command Unbans Everyone Instead Of The Specific Player...HELP!
item.dc:creator: @mr_bob_silab2 mr bob silab2
item.description:
@mr_bob_silab2 wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

Make the command copy the ban list to a temporary file, except for the name of the person you want to un-ban, then have it delete the main ban list and re-make the file with the names in the temporary file. Then delete the temporary file.

Your retarted.

item.title: My Unban Command Unbans Everyone Instead Of The Specific Player...HELP!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Asante213, post:10, topic:249999”]if your using delta then you cant, the only thing you can do is go into the config folder, go into bans.txt and remove the name.Change The PlayerRights, if you want its set to 1

BUT IF YOUR NOT USING DELTA

Wasnt made by me (No Credits To Me)

[code]else if(command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 1) { //made by eczema3
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");
if(file.exists()) {
String victim = command.substring(5);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully unbanned”); //King free
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
String unban = command.substring(6);
String inFile;
while((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
if(inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {
// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
} else {
out.write(inFile); //made by King Free
}

		}
	} catch(IOException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
} else {
	System.out.println("Error unbanning user");

}
}

[/code][/quote]

It’s giving me the same problem as mine, it’s unbanning everyone in my banned file.

item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

 } else if (command.startsWith("deban") && playerRights >= 3) { // made by Musicmad
            File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

            if (file.exists()) {
                String victim = command.substring(5);

                sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully unbanned"); // made by Musicmad	
                try {
                    BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                    BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                    String unban = command.substring(6);
                    String inFile;

                    while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                        if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                        } else {
                            out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                        }

                    }
                } catch (IOException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            } else {
                System.out.println("Error unbanning user"); 	
            }

[code]if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have banned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ban..");
            }
        }[/code]

item.title: My Unban Command Unbans Everyone Instead Of The Specific Player...HELP!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Ok so whenever I would use my unban command like if I did ::unban runefreak10 it would unban me along with everyone else in the banned file. Basically it will empty and clear it out so it’s really pointless. Here is my command, can somebody please help me because I honestly have no idea and I’ve sat there and stared at it trying to figure it out: [code] } else if (command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 2) { // made by Musicmad
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

        if (file.exists()) {
            String victim = command.substring(5);

            sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully unbanned"); // made by Musicmad	
            try {
                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                String unban = command.substring(6);
                String inFile;

                while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                    if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                    } else {
                        out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                    }

                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Error unbanning user"); 	
        }
    }[/code]

If you need anymore information, like my banuser command or anything, then please ask me for it and I’ll give it to you.

Read full topic
